org.apache.distributedlog

Interface AsyncLogReader

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AsyncCloseable

    public interface AsyncLogReader
extends AsyncCloseable

    • Method Detail

      • getStreamName

        String getStreamName()
        Get stream name that the reader reads from.
        Returns:
        stream name.

      • readNext

        com.twitter.util.Future<LogRecordWithDLSN> readNext()
        Read the next record from the log stream
        Returns:
        A promise that when satisfied will contain the Log Record with its DLSN.

      • readBulk

        com.twitter.util.Future<List<LogRecordWithDLSN>> readBulk(int numEntries)
        Read next numEntries entries. The future is only satisfied with non-empty list of entries. It doesn't block until returning exact numEntries. It is a best effort call.
        Parameters:
        numEntries - num entries
        Returns:
        A promise that when satisfied will contain a non-empty list of records with their DLSN.

      • readBulk

        com.twitter.util.Future<List<LogRecordWithDLSN>> readBulk(int numEntries,
                                                          long waitTime,
                                                          TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Read next numEntries entries in a given waitTime.

        The future is satisfied when either reads numEntries entries or reaches waitTime. The only exception is if there isn't any new entries written within waitTime, it would wait until new entries are available.

        Parameters:
        numEntries - max entries to return
        waitTime - maximum wait time if there are entries already for read
        timeUnit - wait time unit
        Returns:
        A promise that when satisfied will contain a non-empty list of records with their DLSN.
